channel.title: Hulp me with Moperscape!
channel.description:
Hai.
Well this afternoon I thought - hey, lets make something for private server kiddies. So I started making a item/npc/etc viewer & editor. Not for the models ;) Just for the data. Then after about an hour I decided I didn't really want to. So here we have what I did end up finishing. Yay, an item viewer. Oh joy. What a momentous occasion. Okey, enough of that. I'm just posting it in case someone wants to finish it, or drool over my amazing code *cough*. =]
[size=8pt][i] Psst. I posted it here because it's java - and to my knowledge moparisthebest.com doesn't believe in using java too much.[/i][/size]

item.title: Hulp me with Moperscape!
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:3, topic:117992”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=167296.msg1555683#msg1555683 date=1183136837]
lmao, nice one. Btw, i just had a thought. wasn’t the original winterlove server under GNU/GPL? That means they aren’t allowed to sell their homemade shitty copies, it’s supposed to be free.
[/quote]

Actually you need to read the actual license:

http://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl.txt

[quote]When we speak of free software, we are referring to freedom, not
price. Our General Public Licenses are designed to make sure that you
have the freedom to distribute copies of free software (and charge for
this service if you wish), that you receive source code or can get it
if you want it, that you can change the software or use pieces of it
in new free programs; and that you know you can do these things.
[/quote]

You can sell the code, you are simply required to provide the source.

Thanks for posting Iamadam, I’m sure someone will find this useful, even if they just use it to learn from. :)[/quote]

Same with *ubuntu, as long as you provide the source on demand(if I recall).

Hey, anyone wanna buy Kubuntu?

Read full topic

item.title: Hulp me with Moperscape!
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Speljohan:

lmao, nice one. Btw, i just had a thought. wasn’t the original winterlove server under GNU/GPL? That means they aren’t allowed to sell their homemade shitty copies, it’s supposed to be free.

Actually you need to read the actual license:

http://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl.txt

When we speak of free software, we are referring to freedom, not price. Our General Public Licenses are designed to make sure that you have the freedom to distribute copies of free software (and charge for this service if you wish), that you receive source code or can get it if you want it, that you can change the software or use pieces of it in new free programs; and that you know you can do these things.

You can sell the code, you are simply required to provide the source.

Thanks for posting Iamadam, I’m sure someone will find this useful, even if they just use it to learn from.

Read full topic
